project.title: Conversion analysis of the syngas production from single-use absorbent waste materials and its applicability for power generation in industries/hospitals through RCCI combustion
project.funding_agency: Science and Engineering Research Board (SERB), Department of Science & Technology (DST), Government of India
project.principal_investigator: Dr. Paramvir Singh, Assistant Professor, Mechanical Engineering Department, NIT Agartala
project.file_no: NITA-11(20-ME)/Start up Research Grant/SERB project/Dr. Paramvir Singh/2022
project.duration: Temporary, renewable each year subject to satisfactory performance, maximum 2 years

position.name: Junior Research Fellow (JRF)
essential_qualification: M.Tech/ME in Mechanical/Energy Engineering with specialization in Fluid/Thermal Engineering
Minimum 60% marks or CGPA 6.5 and above
Relaxation for SC/ST & PwD as per Government of India norms

application.how_to_apply: Submit prescribed application form (available on Institute website) with self-attested scanned copies of all certificates merged into a single PDF to psingh.me@nita.ac.in or dr.psingh@outlook.com
application.email_subject: Application for the post of JRF in SRG project

instructions: Only shortlisted candidates will be intimated for the interview via email
Position is purely temporary and renewable up to 2 years based on performance
Authority reserves the right to accept or reject any/all applications
For queries, contact PI via email
